citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
The sheltered indoor area of the facility was clean, however six outdoor runs were excessively soiled with fecal material.
Material was seen mostly on the solid part and some on the mesh area of those outdoor runs and appeared some dogs
had stepped in the waste. Excreta (fecal material and waste) must be removed daily. Excessive excreta that dogs walk
in can cause animal discomfort and cause disease hazards. To protect dog health and comfort, the facility must ensure to
maintain a daily routine of removing waste and excreta/fecal material.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
3.11(a)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
The sheltered indoor area of the facility was clean, however six outdoor runs were excessively soiled with fecal material.  
Material was seen mostly on the solid part and some on the mesh area of those outdoor runs and appeared some dogs 
had stepped in the waste.   Excreta (fecal material and waste) must be removed daily.  Excessive excreta that dogs walk 
in can cause animal discomfort and cause disease hazards.  To protect dog health and comfort, the facility must ensure to 
maintain a daily routine of removing waste and excreta/fecal material. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
End Section
